title: From Court to Congress to the Mideast, Trump Tallies His Wins
summary: There are serious questions about the wisdom and durability of President Trump’s policies, but on his terms, he can point to a string of accomplishments.

title: How Republicans Re-engineered the Tax Code
summary: The product of years of Republican effort, the American tax code now blends traditional supply-side economics with President Trump’s populist 2024 campaign promises.

title: White House to Start Notifying Countries About Tariffs, Trump Says
summary: After striking only a few trade deals since declaring a 90-day pause in April, President Trump said he would announce new duties starting Friday.

title: A Solid Report Card for the Markets, Despite Shock and Worry
summary: While the Trump administration has engaged in continual disruptions, most investors have prospered.

title: Why Beef Prices Have Hit a Record
summary: Smaller cattle herds and a decade of headwinds for the industry are expected to push up the cost of burgers and steaks for several years.

title: China Sets Steep Duties on European Brandy but Spares Biggest Producers
summary: Major Cognac companies made concessions to avoid the worst of the penalties, imposed by Beijing in retaliation for E.U. tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles.

title: Russia Hits Ukraine With Large Air Barrage Hours After Trump-Putin Call
summary: It was the latest in a series of almost weekly large-scale missile and drone attacks. President Trump said he “didn’t make any progress” with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.

title: From Cooking on TV to Feeding the Front Line in Ukraine
summary: This chef appeared on TV before joining the army when Russia invaded in 2022. Now he makes his borscht for troops instead of cooking show judges.

title: Macy’s 4th of July Fireworks: Where to Watch in NYC
summary: The Macy’s celebration, replete with 80,000 firework shells and 11 new pyrotechnic effects, returns to the East River after heading over to the Hudson in 2024.

title: Some Ways Fireworks Impact Animals and People
summary: Firework displays can harm animals and create bursts of pollution with lingering effects, but there are ways to mitigate them.

title: Heavy Rains Cause Deadly Flooding and Evacuations in Texas
summary: The authorities confirmed that people had died as a result of the flooding along the Guadalupe River, and urged those living near the river to seek higher ground immediately.

title: A Space-Out Competition in Seoul Was Harder Than I Expected
summary: I spent 90 minutes attempting to empty my mind and slow my heartbeat at a “space out” competition. It was harder — and weirder — than I expected.

title: Where Do Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire Negotiations Stand?
summary: Hamas wants to ensure that the latest cease-fire proposal has sufficient guarantees that negotiations will lead to a permanent end to the Gaza war.

summary: The withdrawal of international inspectors comes amid heightened concerns that Iran, battered by Israeli and U.S. strikes, may be driven to try to build a nuclear bomb.

title: Move Over, $100 Lobster Salad. In the Hamptons, These Melons Cost $400.
summary: Gourmet grocery stores are upping their game in the Hamptons, serving a welcoming wealthy clientele.

summary: Exceptionally high temperatures strained electricity systems as people sought air-conditioning, although many did not have that option.

title: As Fire Videos Compete With Beach Photos, Greeks Who Rely on Tourism Are Worried
summary: More than 1,500 people were evacuated when a fire broke out on the southeastern tip of Crete, most of them tourists.

title: Wildfires Sweep Syria’s Coast as Drought Strains Fragile State
summary: Firefighting efforts have been hampered by the presence of mines and unexploded ordnance left over from the civil war, as the country grapples with the worst drought in decades.

title: Oasis Starts Its World Tour With Cardiff Concert
summary: Liam and Noel Gallagher seem ready to put aside their brotherly rivalry and play the first date of their band’s long-awaited comeback tour.

summary: The band hasn’t played a show since 2009, but the quarreling Gallaghers kept their names in the news by mastering the art of the troll, on social media and beyond.

summary: The more things change, the more they stay the same.

title: The Fourth
summary: Politics are colliding with the holiday this year.

title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Faces Not Just a Sentencing, but a Host of Civil Cases
summary: The music mogul, convicted on lesser charges at his federal trial, has been accused of sexually assaulting people in dozens of suits. He has denied the allegations.

title: Nobel Prize-Winning Physicist Is Stripped of Dutch Citizenship
summary: Thirteen years ago, Andre Geim took British citizenship to accept a knighthood. He has just learned he can no longer be a citizen of the Netherlands as a result.

title: S. Daniel Abraham, the Force Behind Slim-Fast, Dies at 100
summary: He turned a tiny family business into a billion-dollar weight-loss empire by replacing calorie counting and forbidden foods with “just add milk.”
